pullRequest.body:
An abbreviation `ObjectProperty C` for predicates on objects of a category `C` is introduced in the file `CategoryTheory.ObjectProperty.Basic`. The file `CategoryTheory.ClosedUnderIsomorphisms` is moved to `ObjectProperty.ClosedUnderIsomorphisms`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

`+ instance : ObjectProperty.IsClosedUnderIsomorphisms (IsIndObject (C := C))`
`+ instance : S.isoClosure.P.IsClosedUnderIsomorphisms := by`

`+ le_of_isLE`
`+ prop_iff_of_isIso`
`+ prop_iff_of_iso`
`+ prop_isoClosure`

`+ shift_le`
`+ shift_shift`
`+ shift_zero`
`+-+ isoClosure`
`- instance : ClosedUnderIsomorphisms (IsIndObject (C := C))`
`- instance : ClosedUnderIsomorphisms (isoClosure P)`
`- instance : ClosedUnderIsomorphisms (mk' P zero shift ext₂).P`

`- predicateShift_closedUnderIsomorphisms`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: joelriou can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Out of curiosity: have you checked how hard it is to make this into a `def` instead of an `abbrev`? Would this be feasible as a future refactor?
This should be possible, but there are instances/lemmas about pi types which we do not necessarily want to duplicate.
The module doc of this file should be updated I think.

```suggestion
this file introduces the type class `P.IsClosedUnderIsomorphisms`.
```

Hmm, there is a question about naming here, or more specifically about capitalization. Things of type `C → Prop` should start with a capital letter according to the naming convention, while things of type `Set C` start with a small letter. Morphism properties start with small letters, which I think is a good convention, so I think object properties should start with a small letter as well. In this case, a good new name for `PredicateShift` might be `ObjectProperty.shift`. What do you think?

If you agree but want to keep the diff small, feel to mark this as a TODO for future cleanup.

Similar questions apply to `Triangulated.Subcategory.P` and `TStructure.LE`/`TStructure.GE` , and also `IsIndObject` (which I will make into an object property once this PR is merged).

Here, I also prefer the small letter convention, which I shall implement for `PredicateShift` (as `ObjectProperty.shift`) and `TStructure.le/ge`. (For triangulated subcategories, a slightly more significant refactor is necessary; which I shall do later on. And for ind-objects, I am happy to let you do it.)
I believe you're missing a deprecation for `isoClosure`.
Should the structure fields of `TStructure` also receive deprecations?

pullRequest.title: refactor(CategoryTheory): introduce ObjectProperty
